NYT > U.S. News.title: The Coronavirus Swamps Local Health Departments, Already Crippled by Cuts
NYT > U.S. News.summary: Many state and municipal health departments saw budget and staffing cuts a decade ago that were never restored.

NYT > U.S. News.title: An Isolation Center Opened to Protect People From Coronavirus. Then Someone Wandered Out.
NYT > U.S. News.summary: A homeless person being tested for the coronavirus wandered out of a new isolation housing facility south of Seattle, prompting alarm from neighbors who wish their town hadn’t been chosen.

NYT > U.S. News.title: Coronavirus Is Shutting Schools. Is America Ready for Virtual Learning?
NYT > U.S. News.summary: Educators experienced with remote learning warn that closures can affect children’s academic progress, safety and social lives.

NYT > U.S. News.title: Efforts to Control the Coronavirus in the U.S. Could Get Even More Extreme
NYT > U.S. News.summary: Schools are closed. Events are canceled. If the virus keeps spreading, governments have even more disruptive options in mind.

NYT > U.S. News.title: Trump Is Tested for Coronavirus, and Experts Ask: What Took So Long?
NYT > U.S. News.summary: Federal officials are asking Americans for extraordinary vigilance against a new pathogen. President Trump has taken a different course, worrying scientists.

NYT > U.S. News.title: How to Protect Older People From the Coronavirus
NYT > U.S. News.summary: People over 60, and especially over 80, are particularly vulnerable to severe or fatal infection. Here are some steps to reduce their risk.

NYT > U.S. News.title: How the Coronavirus Could Hurt the Accuracy of the 2020 Census
NYT > U.S. News.summary: Many people were already hard to count or suspicious of participating in the census. The virus will amplify those problems.

NYT > U.S. News.title: Here’s What’s in Congress’s Emergency Coronavirus Bill
NYT > U.S. News.summary: The package includes free coronavirus testing for all, but its two weeks of paid sick don’t apply to many workers. The Senate is expected to take up the measure early next week.

NYT > U.S. News.title: Local and State Officials Unlock Sweeping Powers to Fight Coronavirus
NYT > U.S. News.summary: At least 40 states and territories have declared states of emergency in response to the virus, giving them the authority to impose curfews, order traffic off the street and mandate quarantines.

NYT > U.S. News.title: Internet Providers Won’t Cut Off Users Over Unpaid Bills for 60 Days
NYT > U.S. News.summary: The pledge some companies took, in the face of the coronavirus pandemic, also calls for them to open public Wi-Fi hot spots and waive late fees, the F.C.C. said.

NYT > U.S. News.title: On a Saturday Night in Florida, a Presidential Party Became a Coronavirus Hot Zone
NYT > U.S. News.summary: A weekend getaway at Mar-a-Lago put the president in contact with several people who later tested positive for the virus. The White House physician said the president had tested negative for the virus.

NYT > U.S. News.title: Coronavirus in California: School Districts Closed
NYT > U.S. News.summary: Saturday: California’s largest school districts have shut down, affecting more than 1,000,000 students across the state.

NYT > U.S. News.title: Biden Builds a Lead as Sanders Presses On: This Week in the 2020 Race
NYT > U.S. News.summary: The coronavirus has dominated the news and is wreaking havoc on the political world. Nonetheless, the race for the Democratic nomination continues (with some modifications).

NYT > U.S. News.title: He Has 17,700 Bottles of Hand Sanitizer and Nowhere to Sell Them
NYT > U.S. News.summary: Amazon cracked down on coronavirus price gouging. Now, while the rest of the world searches, some sellers are holding stockpiles of sanitizer and masks.

National.title: Why outbreaks like coronavirus spread exponentially, and how to ?flatten the curve?

National.summary: No zombies, no riots, but panic-buying in shops and panic-selling of stocks show people are rattled.

National.summary: Some said Rep. Katie Porter's refusal to let CDC Director Robert Redfield off the hook will save lives.

National.summary: Schools and churches have closed in Cynthiana, Ky. Businesses are already suffering.
